txt_en: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
txt_cn: 生活中沉稳可靠、井井有条，方能在工作中脱颖而出、不同凡响。
author: Gustave Flaubert

txt_en: We first make our habits, then our habits make us.
txt_cn: 我们养成习惯，接着习惯成就我们。
author: John Dryden

txt_en: Every individual has a place to fill in the world.
txt_cn: 每一个来到这个世界上的人，都有一个属于他自己的位置。
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

txt_en: If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.
txt_cn: 月亮要是笑起来，她就会和你一样。
author: Sylvia Plath

txt_en: The landscape belongs to the person who looks at it.
txt_cn: 风景属于那些看风景的人。
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

txt_en: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
txt_cn: 无论是你的过去，还是将来，与你的内在相比，都微不足道。
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

txt_en: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise and most possible.
txt_cn: 想要触摸天上星辰，志存高远；想要触碰心灵，明智且最可行。
author: Maya Angelou

txt_en: Half of the troubles of this life can be traced to saying yes too quickly and not saying no soon enough.
txt_cn: 生活中有半数烦恼，来自于答应得太快和拒绝得太慢。
author: Josh Billings

txt_en: It is not worth the while to let our imperfections disturb us always.
txt_cn: 犯不着总是为自己的不完美而烦恼。
author: Henry David Thoreau

txt_en: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods; there is a rapture on the lonely shore.
txt_cn: 无径之林，常有乐趣；无人之岸，几多欢喜。
author: Lord Byron

txt_en: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters.
txt_cn: 凡在小事上对真理持轻率态度的人，在大事上就不能被委以信任。
author: Albert Einstein

txt_en: He who plants a tree, plants a hope.
txt_cn: 种下一棵树，就是种下一个希望。
author: Lucy Larcom

txt_en: The golden rule is that there are no golden rules.
txt_cn: 真正的金科玉律就是世上并无金科玉律。
author: George Bernard Shaw

txt_en: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
txt_cn: 爱一个人，就要放手；若能回来，便永远属于你；若没回来，便从未属于过你。
author: Kahlil Gibran

txt_en: Personality is to a man what perfume is to a flower.
txt_cn: 个性之于人正如芳香之于花。
author: Charles M. Schwab

txt_en: The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do.
txt_cn: 世界需要梦想家，也需要实践者，但这世界最需要的是能实践的梦想家。
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

txt_en: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
txt_cn: 充分利用既有结果的人，就会获得最佳结果。
author: John Wooden

txt_en: Keep your best wishes close to your heart and watch what happens.
txt_cn: 心怀最美好的愿望，再看看会发生什么。
author: Tony DeLiso

txt_en: If you saturate your mind with positive thoughts, it will sustain you in any situation.
txt_cn: 让大脑装满积极的想法，能支撑你度过任何境遇。
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

txt_en: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
txt_cn: 当你感到似乎事事不顺时，记住，飞机都是逆风起飞的，不是顺风。
author: Henry Ford

txt_en: People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.
txt_cn: 你的话，别人能听到，但你的态度才是别人能感受到的。
author: John C. Maxwell

txt_en: Despite the forecast, live like it's spring.
txt_cn: 无论天气预报怎样，把每天都当成春天来过。
author: Lilly Pulitzer

txt_en: Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long, you miss them.
txt_cn: 机会如同日出，等得太久就会错过。
author: William Arthur Ward

txt_en: Take chances; make mistakes. That's how you grow.
txt_cn: 去冒险，去犯错。你就是这样成长起来的。
author: Mary Tyler Moore

txt_en: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
txt_cn: 人们总说时间会改变一切，但改变还是要靠你自己。
author: Andy Warhol

txt_en: Happiness, it comes on unexpectedly. And goes beyond, really, any early morning talk about it.
txt_cn: 幸福，在不经意间降临，它着实胜过每个谈论幸福的清晨。
author: Raymond Carver

txt_en: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
txt_cn: 光站在那里盯着海面，是没法穿越海洋的。
author: 泰戈尔

txt_en: Do something wonderful; people may imitate it.
txt_cn: 去做美好的事，人们可能会效仿。
author: Albert Schweitzer

txt_en: All human wisdom is summed up in these two words: wait and hope.
txt_cn: 人类所有的智慧可以归结为两个词：等待和希望。
author: Alexandre Dumas

txt_en: You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry; don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
txt_cn: 你只是到这作短暂停留而已，不要匆忙，不要忧愁，务必要去感受下沿途的花香。
author: Walter Hagen
